title: Logo for Web Design Business
content:
Hello,

and sorry for opening yet another thread.

I am running a web design business and my current logo can be seen here: [http://www.designbits.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023630/http:/www.designbits.de/)

I am not happy with it however, and this is the new idea I just came up with:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023630im_/http:/typophile.com/files/designbits_6465.png)

The concept isn't radically new, I know, but it fits the purpose very well IMHO.

What do you think?

Thanks for any feedback...
author: Tintin81

comments.content:
I like your present logo a lot more then this new idea...

But, if you are planning to use this, I would make the type about 20% smaller. I would also experiment with other typefaces. Perhaps something more mechanical/square to match the mark, or if your going for friendly, try lowercase and aligning the type to the bottom of the square.

Jeo.

Well this is a great logo, but unfortunatelly it's a perfect rip-off from Lawrence Anderson... [http://www.designedbyanderson.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023630/http:/www.designedbyanderson.com/ "http://www.designedbyanderson.com/")  
Just flip it.  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
_Robert Koritnik_

Here's a couple of the marks roughly based on the same idea:

[http://logopond.com/gallery/detail/38216](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023630/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/38216 "http://logopond.com/gallery/detail/38216")  
 [http://logopond.com/gallery/detail/4442](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023630/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/4442 "http://logopond.com/gallery/detail/4442")
Wow yeah, just rotate 90° clockwise and reflect over the x axis.

Arghhh... That's true. Didn't see that coming... You think I can't use it even if I modify it?

[Webdesign Hamburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023630/http:/www.designbits.de/)
